product_line_or_model: Professional specification recurring fields and trends
evidence_type: Aggregated from Caroma Specify portal + Stormtech + Methven + Fienza + Decina
key_spec_trends: RECURRING SPEC FIELDS: (1) WELS star rating (min 4-Star for toilets, 3-Star+ for tapware); (2) WaterMark certification (mandatory for all plumbing products under AS/NZS 3718); (3) AS1428.1 accessible/ambulant compliance flags; (4) Trap type (P-Trap/S-Trap/Universal) and set-out dimensions; (5) Inlet type (bottom/back entry, concealed cistern); (6) Lead-free tapware (May 2026 WaterMark requirement); (7) Cleanflush/rimless toilet technology; (8) GermGard antimicrobial (Caroma premium); (9) Finish options (Chrome dominant, Matte Black growing, Brushed Bronze/Brushed Nickel/Brushed Gold emerging); (10) BIM file availability (RFA/DAE/SKP) for architectural specification; (11) 316 stainless steel for drainage (WaterMark + corrosion resistance); (12) AS 3740:2021 wet area waterproofing compliance; (13) NCC 2022 livable housing level threshold requirements; (14) Collection coordination (matching tapware/accessories/sanitaryware); (15) Wall-faced and wall-hung toilet configurations
notes: Aggregated recurring specification fields observed across manufacturer portals. Professional specifications emphasize compliance attributes (WELS/WaterMark/AS1428.1/AS3500/NCC) and technical detail (trap type, set-out, inlet type) not typically present in consumer product descriptions.
